content: branchlet gressmanoriginals sizes extra small small medium large extra large measurements circumference 16 18 20 22 24 / 41 46 51 56 61 cm height 7 8 8 5 9 9 5 18 20 22 23 24 cm materials alpaca d auxvasse suri/merino dk 85% suri alpace/15% merino 7 oz/200 g 50 g mc rust 32 g c1 grasshopper 26 g c2 grape us 3 3 25 mm 16 /40 cm needle or preferred style for knitting in the round us 5 3 75 mm 16 /40 cm needle or preferred style for knitting in the round us5 3 75 mm dpn s for crown of hat tapestry needle 1 stitch marker for beginning of round gauge 24 st / 44 row = 4 /10 cm in slip_stitch pattern using larger needle and working in the round after blocking abbreviations k2tog = knit 2 stitches together one stitch decreased eor = end of round sl1wyib = slip 1 stitch as if to purl holding yarn to back of work sl1wyif = slip 1 stit as if to purl holding yarn to front of work ssk = slip 2 stitches one at a time as if to knit then knit those 2 stitches together through the back loops one stitch decreased x ___ = work instructions inside the the number of times after the x designer notes this design is a creative way to use up those odds and ends of leftover yarn that are too pretty to discard but not enough to make a project on their own amounts given above in the materials section will be enough to make a size xl hat detailed amounts for smaller sizes can be found on page 2 © 2025 susan gressman for personal use only all rights reserved branchlet page 1 size xs size s size m size l size xl mc 26 g 32 g 38 g 44 g 50 g c2 16 g 21g 24 g 28 g 32 g c3 13 g 17 g 20 g 23 g 26 g instructions using smaller needle and mc cast on 92 104 116 128 140 stitches using your favorite stretchy cast on samples all used long tail method place marker and join to work in the round work k2p2 ribbing until band measures 1 1 1 5 1 5 1 5 / 2 5 2 5 3 8 3 8 3 8 cm or desired length change to larger needle and knit one round then begin main body pattern as you work the pattern do not cut yarns when changing colors loosely carry unused colors making sure to twist new color around previous color at every change main body pattern using c2 round 1 *k1 sl1wyib repeat from * to eor round 2 k using c3 round 3 *k1 sl1wyif repeat from * to eor round 4 k using mcrnd 5 *k1 sl1wyib repeat from * to eor round 6 k using c2 round 7 *k1 sl1wyif repeat from * to
